customer_addr:
2183 WISCONSIN DELLS PARKWAY
WISC DELLS, WI 53965

citations.narrative:
The facility's contingency plan has not been reviewed on an annual basis to determine if it adequately addresses possible
situations that could occur at the facility. An updated contingency plan for the animal facility helps facilities prevent,
prepare and plan for possible emergency situations. Ensure that the facility contingency plan is reviewed and updated (in
writing) as necessary but no less than annually.
***Correct by 18-July-2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
An updated and documented plan for environmental enhancement for the non-human primates at the facility was not
available. The plan in place was approved by the facilities' previous attending veterinarian (AV). An approved
environmental (enrichment) plan that addresses the social needs and physical environment of the non-human primates is
important to ensure they can express their species-typical behaviors in their enclosure on a regular basis. Ensure to
contact the AV to develop and document and approved plan for the environmental enhancement for non-human primates.
***Correct by 15-July-2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
A written program of environmental enhancement for birds that has been approved by the attending veterinarian was not
available for inspection. A written plan that addresses environment and social housing of birds is required to be in place
and approved by the attending veterinarian to ensure that each bird species is allowed species-typical behaviors. Ensure
to contact the attending veterinarian (AV) to develop and document a plan that is approved by the AV.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility's contingency plan has not been reviewed on an annual basis to determine if it adequately addresses possible 
situations that could occur at the facility. An updated contingency plan for the animal facility helps facilities prevent, 
prepare and plan for possible emergency situations. Ensure that the facility contingency plan is reviewed and updated (in 
writing) as necessary but no less than annually.  
***Correct by 18-July-2025. 
3.81 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
An updated and documented plan for environmental enhancement for the non-human primates at the facility was not 
available. The plan in place was approved by the facilities' previous attending veterinarian (AV). An approved 
environmental (enrichment) plan that addresses the social needs and physical environment of the non-human primates is 
important to ensure they can express their species-typical behaviors in their enclosure on a regular basis. Ensure to 
contact the AV to develop and document and approved plan for the environmental enhancement for non-human primates.  
***Correct by 15-July-2025. 
3.154  Repeat
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
A written program of environmental enhancement for birds that has been approved by the attending veterinarian was not 
available for inspection. A written plan that addresses environment and social housing of birds is required to be in place 
and approved by the attending veterinarian to ensure that each bird species is allowed species-typical behaviors. Ensure 
to contact the attending veterinarian (AV) to develop and document a plan that is approved by the AV. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
